messages.message:
@Heymian can you help chase this one down? Or at least point the right folks to this thread? :slightly_smiling_face:

23.10 remains uncertified this week, and tests are still failing unfortunately :disappointed:
Sure looks like @lydia for all those test failures
@pauline.comising can you take a look at these system tests? (dom is out today)

@William Helmrath did we merge the Helm fix to 24.01?  Or did I misremember my own stuff from this morning? :sweat_smile:
```failed: UpgradeWorker.runAnyTaskForCurrentStage failed: TurnupTask.Process Failed: KubernetesHelper.syncAllConfigsAndWaitForReadiness Failed: SyncConfigsToK8s: ApplyK8sConfigs: not all configs were successfully applied: {"pdb-api-server":"poddisruptionbudgets.policy \"pdb-api-server\" is invalid: metadata.resourceVersion: Invalid value: 0x0: must be specified for an update","pdb-apps-server":"poddisruptionbudgets.policy \"pdb-apps-server\" is invalid: metadata.resourceVersion: Invalid value: 0x0: must be specified for an update","pdb-core-platform-service":"poddisruptionbudgets.policy \"pdb-core-platform-service\" is invalid: metadata.resourceVersion: Invalid value: 0x0: must be specified for an update","pdb-file-tservice":"poddisruptionbudgets.policy \"pdb-file-tservice\" is invalid: metadata.resourceVersion: Invalid value: 0x0: must be specified for an update","pdb-server-nginx":"poddisruptionbudgets.policy \"pdb-server-nginx\" is invalid: metadata.resourceVersion: Invalid value: 0x0: must be specified for an update","pdb-webapp":"poddisruptionbudgets.policy \"pdb-webapp\" is invalid: metadata.resourceVersion: Invalid value: 0x0: must be specified for an update"}```
this looks like a different error actually, but related
cc @puneet this seems related to some incorrect pdb configurations, looks like its missing `metadata.resourceVersion` ?

@William Helmrath I did encounter this error while testing and it was fixed, we might be missing the back port - https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C027EPGM2UQ/p1706019459290329?thread_ts=1704460165.892119&channel=C027EPGM2UQ&message_ts=1706019459.290329 (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C027EPGM2UQ/p1706019459290329?thread_ts=1704460165.892119&channel=C027EPGM2UQ&message_ts=1706019459.290329)
@Ashwin was the fix backported to 24.01?
No we didnt backport the changes to 24.01
Let me put up a PR
Will put up the PR in a little bit sorry

For the system tests, I tried manually running a training jobs, and they never seem to get past `Starting Training Job`, meaning they're never executed off the queue. Though, after starting a job and refreshing, the UI says there are `0 jobs in queue`. I saw job service logs for starting the job, then in ray-head logs I saw `Submitting job with RAY_ADDRESS = 10.170.10.182:6380`, but ray worker logs didn't seem to show anything to indicate the job was picked up. Could we get ray eyes on this problem?

okay so the backport is more involved than I thought, we need to upgrade the `client-go` by a few versions, leading to breaking changes in the code which I need time to test, are we comfortable undoing the PDB backports for now, to unblock the certify and then re-merge next week?
